00021 
00022 #include "copynumber/DataBlock.h"
00023 //
00024 
00025 using namespace std;
00026 
00027 // The constructor creates a block of data a multiple of the smaller
00028 // block sizes that are summarised for ArrayLevel
00029 DataBlock::DataBlock(unsigned int nrow, unsigned int ncol,
00030         int brows, int bcols)
00031     {
00032     nrow = brows*((nrow - 1)/brows + 1);
00033     ncol = bcols*((ncol - 1)/bcols + 1);
00034 
00035     // Here is where the numeric data are stored.
00036     m_data.resize(nrow*ncol,0.0);
00037     m_size = make_pair<unsigned int,unsigned int>(nrow,ncol);
00038 
00039     // Assume the data are missing until seen
00040     m_missing.resize(nrow*ncol,true);
00041 
00042     // The background is estimated in blocks to save computation time.
00043     m_block_size = make_pair<unsigned int,unsigned int>(brows,bcols);
00044 
00045     int sz1 = (nrow - 1)/brows + 1;
00046     int sz2 = (ncol - 1)/bcols + 1;
00047     m_nblocks = make_pair<unsigned int,unsigned int>(sz1,sz2);
00048 
00049     // This is where the background will be estimated.
00050     m_array = new ArrayLevel(sz1,sz2);
00051     }
00052 
00053 
00054 DataBlock::~DataBlock()
00055     {
00056     delete m_array;
00057     m_array = 0;
00058     }
00059 
00060 
00061 // After construction, the data are added
00062 void DataBlock::set_value(const int i, const int j, const double value)
00063     {
00064     m_data[i*m_size.second + j] = value;
00065     m_missing[i*m_size.second + j] = false;
00066     }
00067 
00068 
00069 // For the user to handle by missing values.
00070 bool DataBlock::missing(const int i, const int j) const
00071     {
00072     return m_missing[i*m_size.second + j];
00073     }
00074 
00075 
00076 double DataBlock::get_value(const int i, const int j) const
00077     {
00078     return m_data[i*m_size.second + j];
00079     }
00080 
00081 
00082 // The background is pulled out of the head of the ArrayLevel
00083 double DataBlock::background(const int i, const int j) const
00084     {
00085     return (*m_array)(i/m_block_size.first,j/m_block_size.second).back;
00086     }
00087 
00088 
00089 // Observed minus background.
00090 double DataBlock::residual(const int i, const int j) const
00091     {
00092     if (m_missing[i*m_size.second + j]) return 0;
00093     double value = m_data[i*m_size.second + j];
00094     return value - (*m_array)(i/m_block_size.first,j/m_block_size.second).back;
00095     }
00096 
00097 
00098 // After all the data are loaded by set_value() summaries are propagated
00099 // through the ArrayLevel list.
00100 void DataBlock::load_array_level()
00101     {
00102     int block_size = m_block_size.first*m_block_size.second;
00103 
00104     for (unsigned int i=0; i<m_nblocks.first; i++) {
00105         for (unsigned int j=0; j<m_nblocks.second; j++) {
00106             int row_start = i*m_block_size.first;
00107             int row_end = (i+1)*m_block_size.first;
00108             double mean = 0.0;
00109             int count = 0;
00110             for (int row=row_start; row<row_end; row++)
00111                 {
00112                 int col_start = j*m_block_size.second;
00113                 int col_end = (j+1)*m_block_size.second;
00114                 for (int col=col_start; col<col_end; col++)
00115                     {
00116                     if (m_missing[row*m_size.second + col]) continue;
00117                     mean += m_data[row*m_size.second + col];
00118                     count++;
00119                     }
00120                 }
00121             if (count) mean /= count;
00122             (*m_array)(i,j) = ArrayElement(mean,count,block_size);
00123             }
00124         }
00125 
00126     m_array->load_next_level();
00127     }
00128 
00129 
00130 // Tell the ArrayLevel list to estimate the background
00131 void DataBlock::mrf_smooth(const double local_phi, const double global_phi,
00132         const double converge)
00133     {
00134     m_array->mrf_smooth(local_phi, global_phi, converge);
00135     }
00136 
00137 
00138 // This may not be needed.
00139 ArrayElement DataBlock::get_block(const int i, const int j)
00140     {
00141     return (*m_array)(i,j);
00142     }
